abstract: Photographer Miska Draskoczy, who grew up in the Adirondacks in upstate New York, has expressed fascination for irrepressible wildlife found in New York City; selection of photos of birds and plant life from his exhibit Gowanus Wild are displayed at Brooklyn Public Library.
lead_paragraph: Wandering the neighborhood at night, the photographer Miska Draskoczy found life abounding: green plants pushing up through broken pavement, vines reclaiming graffiti-marked walls, trees throwing bucolic shade over drive-by garbage heaps.

headline.main: A Photographer Finds Abundant Life in and Around the Gowanus Canal

snippet: Wandering the neighborhood at night, the photographer Miska Draskoczy found life abounding: green plants pushing up through broken pavement, vines reclaiming graffiti-marked walls, trees throwing bucolic shade over drive-by garbage heaps.
